pr_title: [KAFKA-10417] Update Cogrouped processor to work with suppress() and joins

timeline.bodyText: I believe PassThrough is only used for the cogroup but now I think you can remove it completely.
timeline.author: wcarlson5

replies.bodyText: It's still used for some of the kstream ksteam internals so I think it's gotta stay for now
replies.author: lct45

timeline.bodyText: I think these lines are too long. The ones in the other methods too
timeline.author: wcarlson5

timeline.bodyText: It looks like the parameter is ignored. Is that correct? If so, it might be nice to add an explanatory comment.
timeline.author: vvcephei

timeline.bodyText: I noticed that queryableName is a different parameter than the one we actually build the parent processors with (storeBuilder.name()). It wouldn't surprise me if there's a subtle difference between them.
timeline.author: vvcephei

replies.bodyText: Looks like they're the same when cogroup is materialized, but if it's not the storeBuilder.name() is auto generated and queryableName is null. With that said, it seems sto me that it would be better to pass storeBuilder.name() to the passThrough, to be safe. WDYT?
replies.author: lct45

replies.bodyText: Yes, that sounds like the right thing to do. Thanks!
replies.author: vvcephei

timeline.bodyText: Just checking: does this fail on trunk?
timeline.author: vvcephei
vvcephei
